Introduction.

Hi, i guess you are here because you have purchased the awesome Chabod portfolio website template, if you have'nt, heres a link to Buy Chabod Now

About Chabod.

Chabod is an amazing portfolio website template built with the bootstrap framework. It comes with 6 different sections to help sellers show their professional profile with style, while remaining as engaging as possible. Chabod is a simple, single page static website, with pop-up features like: a project story pop-up for sharing project stories, and a blog pop-up for displaying blog stories.

Getting Started.

Chabod is built with different front end web development tools and this documentation guides you through as much as is needed to get a hand an them and customize Chabod into the portfolio website of your dream.

Chabod is a straight forward portfolio website template. It's very much pre-built and thus, leaves out the stress of needing to know how to use any of its components like paddings, margins, buttons and etcetera.
The only components that you might wish to know about, is the colour components.
Chabod comes with a black, white, and grey color build. This simple colour pallete adds greatly to it's simplicity.
All color configurations can be found in the config partials of both the light and dark modes - that is, the light-mode-config.scss file, the light-to-dark-mode-config.scss file, the dark-mode-config.scss file and the dark-to-light-mode-config.scss file.

Refer to the colours section below for more on handling colours in Chabod.

Chabod build Tools/Stack.

Chabod is built with the following tools:

  • HTML.
  • CSS.
  • SASS.
  • Bootstrap 5.
  • Ts Particles
  • Vanilla Javascript and
  • Gulp Js
  • Google Maps

Setting up your development environment.

Setting up your development environment to handle Chabod is pretty simple. Just lay a hand on any code editor of you choice like VS Code or Atom, open up the Chabod folder in the code editor, and we are good to go.

HTML.

Chabod is built with regular Html5 markup and Bootstrap 5. This means a good knowledge of the Bootstrap framework will help greatly in handling and customizing Chabod HTML.

CSS and SASS.

Chabod is built with SASS. SASS is a CSS preprocessor - a tool that provides a better and more cool way to write styles. SASS styles are processed/compiled into regular CSS using different tools. In Chabod, Gulp JS is the tool used in compiling SASS into regular CSS. It is the compiled SASS styles(CSS files) that are linked-to in all the head sections of the HTML files contained in Chabod.

The SASS styling in this template follows the component based styling system, this means each section of Chabod is styled seperately thanks to SASS partials -that is, all the 6 different sections of Chabod are styled seperately in different files called partials. These seperations make further development and maintenance to be much easier compared to working directly with the jammed CSS files.

Feel free to work directly with the CSS files if you do not know how to work with SASS yet. You can find all the CSS files inside the "Styles" folder that is contained in the "Dist" folder in Chabod.

In this template, SASS is processed into CSS using Gulp.Js. Refer to the Gulp.Js section below for more on SASS compilation. You do not need to bother a bit about SASS if Gulp is completely set up. So just set up Gulp, and go on with writing SASS - Gulp will automatically do the compiling as configured in the "gulp.js" script.

But please, always remember to run the "gulp watch" command in your command line interface or terminal during development, to ensure that gulp is watching for changes in any SASS file, so that it can compile it into regular CSS. If you fail to do so, SASS will not compile/process into CSS and thus your changes will not be effected.

You can find all the main SASS files and SASS partials in the "Sass" folder that is inside Chabod.

Bootstrap.

Chabod is built with the Bootstrap 5 framework. Bootstrap is a very popular HTML, CSS and Javascript framework. It's only going to take some minutes to set up. All the HTML files in Chabod contains CDN links to the Bootstrap framework for Bootstrap styles and all relevant scripts to get Bootstrap running.

This means that, as long as you are connected to the internet, you can just go ahead with customizing Chabod without needing any setup for Bootstrap.

If you prefer working offline with local bootstrap files, then go ahead and do the necessary downloads and then link to all the necessary files locally. The Bootstrap getting started page should help you out with downloading all the necessary files for local development. So feel free to refer to it for all you will need to set up Bootstrap for local development.

Ts Particles.

Ts particles is a Javascript tool for creating particle effects in websites. The moving particle effect on the home section of Chabod is done by ts particles. Ts particles is a github fork of a similar javascript tool called Particles.js.

With Chabod, you do not need any set up for ts particles. it's all set up already. Both the light and dark modes of Chabod contains customized configurations for ts particles.

The particles effect on Chabod can be changed and customized to produce different particle effects of your choice. Refer to the Ts particles website for how to go about that. This tutorial might also be of great help.

Gulp.Js.

Gulp is a popular javascript tool for automating different development tasks like creating a live server, compiling SASS, CSS auto-prefixing, and etcetera.

In this template, Gulp is used in SASS compilation and CSS auto-prefixing.

Chabod comes with a gulpfile.js script. That leaves you with no special Gulp.js script to write. All you'll need to do, is to install gulp and all the required dependencies (gulp-sass, sass, and gulp auto-prefixer).

Follow these simple steps to get your Gulp.js all set up and functioning.

  • Install gulp in the Chabod folder (You'll need to have node.js installed first).
  • Then run npm install in the command line or terminal when inside the project folder to install all the required dependencies and get gulp all set for compiling SASS and auto prefixing CSS.
    Chabod comes with a package.json file which contains a list of all dependencies required to set up a complete workflow. Hence, simply running the npm install command, directly installs all the listed dependencies in the package.json file.

With all of these all done, You are ready to start enjoying Gulp.Js on your workspace, and you are all set to start building with SASS as well. Isn't it all simple?

Colours

Chabod is built with a simple black, white and greyish color pallette. Using such simple colour combinations leaves out design complexities and also helps to ensure simplicity.

Both the dark and light modes of chabod are built with the same black, white and a greyish color combinations.

You can find all the color configurations in the following SASS partial files.

  • The light-mode-config.scss file
  • The light-to-dark-mode-config.scss file
  • The dark-mode-config.scss file
    • and the
  • The dark-to-light-mode-config.scss file
    • You can also find few color styling inside the Chabod media query file - that is the themequeries.scss file.

Colour manipulation inside Chabod is done by using CSS variables (custom properties) and regular SASS variables.
Checkout all the above listed files to see the colour codes of the various colour variables.

The dark-mode-config.scss file and the dark-mode-config.scss file contain colour configurations for both the light and dark modes of Chabod respectively.

While the dark-to-light-mode-config.scss file and the light-to-dark-mode-config.scss file both contain colour configurations for switching colour modes using Javascript.

Google Maps

Chabod comes with a pre-built interface for embeeding Google maps. However, Chabod(the sales package) does not come preinstalled with Google maps. Here are some reasons why:

1. Every user needs to embeed a google map view of their unique locations. This can only be done after purchase by the user.

2. Excluding Google maps from the purchased package, will prevent any third party issue form arising. This simply means embeeding Google maps on your Chabod website after purchase will only be an agreement between you and Google. Without any third party (developer) issues.

Embeeding a Google map view of your location into the pre-built interface is super easy.

  • First add Your location to Google maps.
  • Open Google maps and select your location to have your location details displayed by Google maps
  • Click the menu on the top right corner of the Google map layout
  • Select Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Nisi, sequi.
  • Copy out the "Embeed a map" code from Google maps
  • Paste the copied embeed code into the div element with a map-case class attribute.
  • Remove every attribute from iframe element in the pasted code leaving only the src, allowfullscreen and loading attributes.
  • Add a map-responsive class attribute to the iframe element.
  • Reload Chabod - and you'll see your google map location display beautifully inside Chabod
